title: Poundland Takeover Of 99p Stores Is Cleared
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Fri, Sep 18, 2015, 10:56 BST - UK Markets close in 5 hrs 34 mins Poundland Takeover Of 99p Stores Is Cleared By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News – 1 hour 2 minutes ago View Photo 

A regulator has cleared the £55m takeover of 99p Stores by Poundland, deciding the combined company will not have to sell any shops to satisfy competition concerns. 
The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) had previously expressed worries about 80 areas of the country but confirmed on Friday it was happy that supermarkets and other discount chains such as Poundworld provided sufficient competition. 
In a statement confirming a provisional ruling last month , the watchdog said: "The CMA has concluded that the merger may not be expected to result in a substantial lessening of competition. 
"Consequently, customers would not face a reduction in choice, value or quality of service as a result of the merger." 
In welcoming the CMA's decision, Poundland chief executive Jim McCarthy said: "We believe that the acquisition of 99p Stores will be great for both customers and for shareholders and we will now move to completion by the end of the month." 
The deal, which will create a chain of 800 stores under the Poundland brand, was initially announced in February. 
Poundland confirmed at that time that 99p customers would have to pay an extra 1p for their products (Other OTC: UBGXF - news ) .
